p: However, hardness is only loosely related to strength. Thus, in some cases, additional compression or tensile tests were performed on samples cooled at controlled rates to certain temperatures. Details of these tests can be found in Refs. [ 37, 117, 132]. In general, thermo-mechanical-analysis (TMA) is performed with a quenching and deformation dilatometer to obtain mechanical properties from tensile [ 144] and compression tests [ 36, 37, 132, 145].
